chav1961.purelib.fsys.interfaces

Interface DataWrapperInterface


  • public interface DataWrapperInterface

    This interface describes a data wrapper to get information about the file system entity.

    This interface is a result for the createDataWrapper(URI) call in the IFileSystem interface. It uses to describe properties and get access to content of the given file system entity. Association between this wrapper and file system entity is defined by the URL parameter in the createDataWrapper(URI) method. As an implementation example, see FileSystemOnFile class

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    AbstractFileSystem class, FileSystemOnFile class

    • Method Detail

      • list

        URI[] list(Pattern pattern)
    throws IOException

        Get URI list for the current

        Parameters:
        pattern - pattern to filter file system entity names

        Returns:
        URI list from the given file system cursor. Can be empty but not null. Each URI need be started with '/', but need be relative to the createDataWrapper(URI) URI.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any exceptions was thrown

      • delete

        void delete()
     throws IOException

        Delete the given file system cursor entity. You don't need implement recursive deletion for subdrirectories!

        Throws:
        IOException - if any exceptions was thrown

      • getOutputStream

        OutputStream getOutputStream(boolean append)
                      throws IOException

        Create an output stream to change or append date into file system cursor entity content

        Parameters:
        append - true if data will be appended
        Returns:
        output stream to write data to the given content. You need override the close() method of the stream to commit store operation in your file system
        Throws:
        IOException - if any exceptions was thrown

      • getInputStream

        InputStream getInputStream()
                    throws IOException

        Create an input stream to get content from the file system cursor entity.

        Returns:
        stream to read content from.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any exceptions was thrown

      • getAttributes

        Map<String,Object> getAttributes()
                          throws IOException

        Get attributes of the given file system cursor entity.

        Returns:
        entity attributes. Need be not null and contain at least ATTR_EXIST key
        Throws:
        IOException - if any exceptions was thrown

      • linkAttributes

        void linkAttributes(Map<String,Object> attributes)
             throws IOException

        Associate attributes with the next getInputStream() or getOutputStream(boolean) operation. This map can be empty. You can use it as to get data from it so put data into it. It's exactly the map used in the read/write and reaChar/writeChar methods family. System guarantees that this method always call before appropriative calling getInputStream() or getOutputStream(boolean).

        Parameters:
        attributes - entity attributes.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any exceptions was thrown
